name: Rowing, Lying on Bench
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on an incline bench with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor.
  
2. Reach up towards the ceiling or a hook if available, gripping it firmly with both hands.

3. Pull yourself up with your arms, keeping your elbows high and your chest expanded. Lean forward slightly to focus on rowing motion.

4. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together as you pull your arms back.

5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.

6. Slowly lower your body down until your arms are fully extended again, keeping control throughout.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Rowing on a lying bench is a chest and shoulder exercise that strengthens these muscles while also engaging the back due to its rowing motion.
